titleproper.value: Guide to the Walter Rosenblum Photographs of Spanish Refugees <num>PHOTOS.249</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-09-19T18:38:54</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Walter Rosenblum Photographs of Spanish Refugees

p.value: Identification of item, date; Walter Rosenblum Photographs of Spanish Refugees; ALBA 249; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Lisa Rosenblum in 2007. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.272.

This collection contains 25 black-and-white photographic prints taken by Walter Rosenblum in Toulouse and Saint-Jean de Luz, France in 1946. The photographs document the lives of Spanish Civil War refugees living in camps and other settlements in Southern France, with emphasis on the war's impact on children and civilian families.
